title: RELATING TO DOMESTIC ABUSE PROTECTIVE ORDERS.
subject: Domestic Abuse Protective Orders
Order for Protection
Penalties
Temporary Restraining Order

abstracts.abstract: Increases the penalties imposed on individuals convicted for violations of temporary restraining orders and orders for protection.  Clarifies that the court shall not sentence a defendant to pay a fine for violating a domestic abuse protective order if the court makes an on-the-record determination that the defendant is or will be unable to pay the fine.  Specifies that any conviction for violation of a temporary restraining order issued under the same judicial case number as an order for protection shall be treated as a prior violation of an order for protection.  Clarifies when the court may suspend certain jail sentences for violations of domestic abuse protective orders.  (HD2)

actions.description: Enrolled to Governor.
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 806).
Passed Final Reading.  Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: none.  Noes, 0 (none).  Excused, 2 (Senator(s) Fevella, Ihara).
Received notice of reconsideration and Senate agreement (Sen. Com. No. 786).

Senate agrees with House amendments.  Placed on the calendar for Final Reading on 04-16-25.

Senate disagrees with House amendments.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 434).

The votes were as follows: 9 Ayes: Representative(s) Tarnas, Poepoe, Belatti, Kahaloa, Perruso, Takayama, Todd, Shimizu; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Garcia;  Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Cochran, Hashem.
Bill scheduled to be heard by JHA on Thursday, 03-20-25 2:00PM in House conference room 325 VIA VIDEOCONFERENCE.
